III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff
Section Rule 126. The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
Description administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff
on duty to perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency’s program statement and to
provide for the continual needs, protection, and supervision of
residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 7/24/23, youth submerged head into laundry tub as a suicide
attempt while staff was present. Youth then ran into an office,
retrieved a bottle of window cleaner that was under the desk and
drank over half of the bottle in the presence of staff.
Investigation This complaint was received on 07/25/2023 and investigated
jointly with the MDHHS Specialist.
On 07/26/2023 a message was left for complainant requesting a
call back.
I interviewed Youth A at the hospital on 07/26/2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A is 14 years old and
has been at the Vista Maria for 7 months. Youth A reported on the
day in question she was upset because of the court hearing she
had in the morning. She wants to get out of Vista Maria and her
worker told her she cannot leave until she can set up services in
the community. Youth A admitted that she first tried to break the
mirror in the bathroom and the Staff A verbally redirected her not
to do that, she then went to the laundry room, put a cloth in the
drain of the laundry tub, filled the laundry tub with water, and
submerged her head, Staff A followed her and removed to cloth
and drained the water. Youth A ran out of the laundry room, jump
over staff’s desk, grabbed the bottle of glass cleaner, and drank it.
She said Staff A followed her and grabbed the bottle of glass
cleaner. Staff called for a clear, contacted the nurse, who called
poison control, and then she was transported to the hospital. She
said there were three staff members on the wing and three other
youths. Youth A was receiving individual therapy, but she does not
like her therapist. She denied having previous thoughts of self-
harming. Youth A said she just wanted to get out of Vista Maria
and hopes that she does not have to go back.
2

I interviewed Consumer Rights Officer at the facility on
07/27/2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Consumer
Rights Officer reported on the day in question there were four staff
members on the wing. Staff were doing the evening chores and
there was a bottle of cleaner that staff placed on the desk. All
cleaning products are kept in a locked closet outside of the wing,
but staff were doing the evening chores and the cleaner is used to
clean the showers after the youths take their showers. There were
three staff members on the wing, staff immediately called for a
“clear” (other youths are removed from the wing), contacted the
nurse, and Youth A was transported to the hospital. There are
incident reports for Youth A for truanting from summer school,
making statements of harm against others, and physically fighting
with other youths, but no reports of Youth A threatening to self-
harm.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 07/27/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is a direct care worker and has
worked at the facility for 3 months. Staff 1 reported she has a
good rapport with Youth A and usually can get through to Youth A,
but on the day in question Youth A was agitated and upset. Youth
A had a sock on her hand, went to the bathroom. and tried to
punch the mirror. Staff 1 talked to Youth A and redirected her
away from the bathroom. Youth went to the laundry room filled up
the laundry sink and put her head under the water. Staff 1 turned
the water off and pulled the stopper out. Youth A ran out of the
laundry room, jumped over the staff desk, grabbed the bottle of
window cleaner, took a couple of sips of the fluid, Staff 2 grabbed
the bottle from Youth A, Youth A tried to grab a second bottle of
cleaner from under the desk, but Staff 2 took the bottle and
poured it in the trash. Staff called a clear, contacted the nurse who
evaluated Youth A, contacted Poison Control and EMS. Staff 1
said all cleaning products are locked in the closet outside of the
wing. The cleaner is brought in when the youths are completing
daily chores and staff are the only ones that handle the cleaning
bottle. Staff spray the cleaning towels, which the youths use to
wipe the windows, couches, and showers after they use them.
While doing evening chores the cleaner is on the staff desk with
the staff.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility on 07/26/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 recalled on 07/24/2023 Youth A
was upset and agitated. He was standing by the desk when Youth
A grabbed the bottle of cleaner and ran off with the bottle. He
followed Youth A and grabbed the bottle from her. He said Youth
A took a couple sips of the cleaner before he grabbed the bottle
3

from her. The nurse was immediately contacted, who immediately
responded, evaluated Youth A, and called EMS. Staff 2 said all
clean products are locked in the closet outside of the wing, but
they were doing the evening chores so that is the reason the
cleaner was on the desk. Staff 2 said there were no previous
reports for Youth A having suicidal ideation or self-harming.
I interviewed Staff 3 and 4 separately at the facility on 07/26/2023,
in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Both staff members
confirmed Youth A was upset and agitated, Staff 1 was following
Youth A and trying to calm her down, Youth A grabbed the glass
cleaner off staff’s desk, Staff 2 followed Youth A and grabbed the
bottle away from her. Staff 3 and 4 helped clear the wing by taking
the other youths to Gym.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 08/11/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist 2. Youth B is on the same wing with Youth
A. On 7/24/2023, Youth A was taking a shower and didn’t witness
the incident involving Youth A but heard that Youth A had drank
window cleaner. Youth A said cleaning products are always
locked and when doing chores staff are the only ones that handle
the cleaners. Youth A reported feeling safe and did not express
any concerns regarding staff or the facility.
I interviewed Youth C at the facility on 08/11/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist 2. Youth C recalled on the day in question
Youth A was upset and acting up. Youth C witnessed Youth A
grab the bottle of cleaner off the staff’s desk and drank the
cleaner. Staff called for a clear and she and the other youths had
to go to the gym. She said all cleaners are always locked, but they
were doing the evening chores and the cleaner was on the staff’s
desk.
I interviewed Therapist on 08/15/2023 via telephone, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Therapist reported Youth A
did not have a history or self-harming prior to this incident. She
said Youth A is frustrated and does not want to be at the facility.
Youth A is on 1:1 staffing since her return to the facility and is
doing better. Youth A has not expressed any concerns regarding
self-harming.
A predisposition conference held with MDHHS Specialist on
08/18/2023. There is no finding by MDHHS Specialist.
4

Video Reviewed:
The video is dated 07/25/2026 at 6:00 pm. Staff and Youths are
observed wiping surfaces and cleaning the wing. At approximately
6:15 Youth A is seen going to the bathroom, Staff 1 follows Youth
A, a few minutes later Youth A comes out of the bathroom and
goes to the laundry room. Staff 1 follows Youth A to the laundry
room, Staff 2 is observed standing by the desk and the bottle of
cleaner is placed on the desk. Youth A comes out of the laundry
room, jumps over the desk, grabs the cleaner, two staff follow
Youth A as she walks away from the desk and one staff grabs the
bottle away from Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Report dated 07/24/2023 at 6:18 pm. Youth was
irritated and began shouting profanity and threatened to harm
herself. Youth A went to the bathroom and hit the mirror with a
sock over her hand, Staff 1 and 2 used verbally de-escalation.
Staff 3 called for a clear- youths entered their unsecured
bedrooms. Youth A went to the laundry room, turned on the
water in the draining tub, filled the tub with water, and dunked
her head. Staff unplugged the drain. Youth lifted her head and
ran out of the laundry room. Youth A reached across the staff
desk and grabbed cleaning solution and took two gulps. Staff 4
retrieved the botte of cleaning solution from Youth A. The
nurse was notified. Nurse contacted poison control and Youth
A was sent to the hospital.
• Nurse assessment ingestion of cleaning fluid dated
07/24/2023. Youth said she does not want to be at Vista Maria
anymore and asked to be taken to the hospital. Youth did not
appear to be in any acute distress. Poison Control contacted,
advised youth should be sent to ER.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule as there is insufficient
evidence that staff were not supervising based on interviews with
Staff, Youths, and video footage. The cleaner was on the desk
because staff and youths were doing the evening chores, when
Youth A grabbed the cleaner off staff’s desk. Staff responded
immediately, called a clear, contacted nurse, and youth was
transported to the hospital.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
